info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 16 at 8:37AM EDT by NWS Detroit
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Wayne County through 930 AM EDT... At 837 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Livonia to near Canton to near Willis. Movement was east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Livonia around 840 AM EDT. Romulus around 845 AM EDT. Southfield, Taylor and Greenfield Village around 850 AM EDT. Detroit and Dearborn around 900 AM EDT. Flat Rock around 905 AM EDT. Downtown Detroit and Trenton around 910 AM EDT. Grosse Pointe, Wyandotte, Grosse Ile and Belle Isle around 915 AM EDT. Other locations impacted by these storms include Melvindale, Gibraltar, New Boston, Rockwood, Harper Woods, Westland, Grosse Pointe Shores, Ecorse, Grosse Pointe Woods and Woodhaven. People attending Canton Liberty Fest, and Redford Township Summer Festival should seek safe shelter immediately! MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
